      org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addAlbum(@Valid AlbumModel album, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      This function attempts to add a new album to the database it first checks to see if the input has any errors if it does then the function creates a new ModelAndView containing the album with errors, the AlbumModel list that represents the users library, and a empty string named error to let the view know to display the modal.

      This method is for adding a new song to the database.

      This method is for removing albums from the database.

    • Method Detail

      • displayLibrary

        @RequestMapping(value="/")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView displayLibrary(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        This function gets all albums in the database that have the current user's ID as their foreign key and returns the user to the library view
        Parameters:
        session - Session variable to get the current user's ID from the principal stored in the session
        Returns:
        Returns a ModelAndView with the view being directed towards the library and the Model being a list of AlbumModels

      • displayAlbum

        @RequestMapping(value="/viewAlbum",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView displayAlbum(@RequestParam
                                                                                                                                 int ID)
        This function gets a single AlbumModel from the database using the ID passed to it
        Parameters:
        ID - This is the ID of the Album that is to be retrieved from the database
        Returns:
        Will return a ModelAndView displaying the album or will return to the error page if an error was encountered

      • addAlbum

        @RequestMapping(path="/add",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addAlbum(@Valid @ModelAttribute(value="album")
                                                                                                                       @Valid AlbumModel album,
                                                                                                                       org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                                                                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        This function attempts to add a new album to the database it first checks to see if the input has any errors if it does then the function creates a new ModelAndView containing the album with errors, the AlbumModel list that represents the users library, and a empty string named error to let the view know to display the modal. Otherwise on success the function returns to the library view with the new album included.
        Parameters:
        album - The AlbumModel to be added into the database
        result - The variable that will store any validation errors
        session - A variable that allows us to get the principal object out of the session to get the user's ID
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView containing the updated library and directing to the library page

      • editAlbum

        @RequestMapping(path="/edit",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editAlbum(@Valid @ModelAttribute(value="album")
                                                                                                                         @Valid AlbumModel album,
                                                                                                                         org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        This method is for editing an album. It takes in the album model that the user passes to it through a form checks to see if it has any errors and if so returns the user back to the form. Otherwise it attempts to proceed to persist the edits in the database and handles any exceptions that are thrown
        Parameters:
        album - The edited instance of the album model the user wants to edit
        result - The variable to store whether or not there are any validation errors
        Returns:
        Returns a ModelAndView that will take the user to an error page, or back to the page they came from

      • deleteAlbum

        @RequestMapping(path="/delete",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView deleteAlbum(@ModelAttribute(value="album")
                                                                                                                             AlbumModel album,
                                                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        This method is for removing albums from the database. If the album is successfully removed then they user is returned back to their library. If there is an error then the user is routed back to the main page and shown an appropriate error message
        Parameters:
        album - The album model containing the album ID of the album to be deleted
        session - The session to get the current user's ID from
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView object directing the user back to the appropriate page with the appropriate objects contained within

      • addSong

        @RequestMapping(path="/addSong",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addSong(@Valid @ModelAttribute(value="song")
                                                                                                                          @Valid SongModel song,
                                                                                                                          org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        This method is for adding a new song to the database. It first checks to see that the song's attributes are valid in the event that they are not it returns the user back to the albumView with the errors. Otherwise the song is added to the database unless there is an error in which case the user is returned back to the main page with an appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        song - The song model to be added to the database
        result - Variable for storing any errors with the song model found
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView object leading the user back to the appropriate page with the necessary model objects

      • editSong

        @RequestMapping(path="/editSong",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editSong(@Valid @ModelAttribute(value="song")
                                                                                                                            @Valid SongModel song,
                                                                                                                            org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        This method is for editing a song that is already persisted in the database. It first checks to see if there are any errors with the edited song model and if there are then the user is directed back to the albumView page that they came from. Otherwise the edits to the song are persisted to the database. In the event that they are successfully persisted then the user is returned back to the albumView page that song is a part of otherwise the user is returned to the main page with an appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        song - The edited song model that the user wants to persist to the database
        result - The object that holds whether or not there were any validation errors on the song model
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView directing the user to the appropriate page with all the appropriate model object contained within

      • deleteSong

        @RequestMapping(path="/deleteSong",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView deleteSong(@ModelAttribute(value="song")
                                                                                                                                SongModel song)
        This method is for removing song models that have been persisted in the database. It attempts to remove the song in the event of a success it returns the user back to the albumView page they came from. In the event of any kind of error the user is instead returned back to the main page with an appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        song - The song model for the song that the user wishes to remove from the database
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView taking the user to the appropriate page with all the necessary objects contained within
